p: Empirical evidence also suggests that the co-occurrence of alcohol use and mental health exacerbates violence outcomes. A nationally representative study in the United States found that reporting a severe mental illness did not predict violence, but reporting both a severe mental illness and substance abuse did [ 40]. Another United States study found that alcohol use strengthened the relationship between mental illness symptoms and perpetration of aggression [ 32]. In addition to these quantitative studies, qualitative research in India has suggested that depressive symptoms interact with alcohol use to drive IPV perpetration [ 41].
